title: Osijek
summary: Osijek (Croatian pronunciation: [ôsijeːk] (listen)) is the fourth-largest city in Croatia, with a population of 108,048 in 2011.[1] It is the largest city and the economic and cultural centre of the eastern Croatian region of Slavonia, as well as the administrative centre of Osijek-Baranja County. Osijek is located on the right bank of the Drava River, 25 km (16 mi) upstream of its confluence with the Danube, at an elevation of 94 m (308 ft).
